definition: a predetermined set of movements in dancing or skating, understand
details:
noun
- a predetermined set of movements in dancing or skating
= example: a predetermined set of movements in dancing or skating
- a decorative or artistic work
= synonyms: pattern
- a model of a bodily form, especially of a person
= example: a model of a bodily form, especially of a person
- the impression produced by a person
= example: the impression produced by a person
- the property possessed by a sum or total or indefinite quantity of units or individuals
= synonyms: number
- alternative names for the body of a human being
= synonyms: shape
- a unitary percept having structure and coherence that is the object of attention and that stands out against a ground
- a diagram or picture illustrating textual material
= synonyms: fig
- language used in a figurative or nonliteral sense
= synonyms: image, trope, figure of speech
- a well-known or notable person
= synonyms: name, public figure
- an amount of money expressed numerically
= example: an amount of money expressed numerically
- one of the elements that collectively form a system of numeration
= synonyms: digit
- a combination of points and lines and planes that form a visible palpable shape
verb
- understand
= example: understand
- make a mathematical calculation or computation
= synonyms: cipher, cypher, work out, reckon, calculate, compute
- judge to be probable
= synonyms: estimate, forecast, reckon, calculate, count on
- imagine
= synonyms: fancy, project, image, picture, see, visualize, visualise, envision
- be or play a part of or in
= example: be or play a part of or in
= synonyms: enter
